page.title: 09BEMPTON'S IT'S A KNOCKOUT
page.content: Bempton and Buckton have very little by way of customs but for the last five years a group of villagers have organised an{It's A Knockout } competition. Teams from Bempton, Buckton, Flamborough and Flamborough {Lifeboat}compete and the money raised by the event is shared between St. Michael's Church, Bempton Village Hall and Flamborough Lifeboat. As many visitors are attracted by the cliffs it is almost inevitable that there are some accidents. Thus we have strong links with the Lifeboat, {Coastguard }and {Air Sea Rescue } service. It is for this reason that the Knockout involves a Lifeboat team and for the last two years has been opened by the coastguard,Mr. Vic Crossthwaite, firing a maroon and a fly-past by the {R.A.F.}rescue helicopter.
